Author: Ray Uber#2790
Content:
Hey guys, I'm relatively new to Komodo and want to ask something about the privacy. On the Komodo's website it says " In its most simple form, the Komodo coin can be used to make purchases with privacy." 
Does this mean the Komodo coin is anonymous by default? And only other coins on the Komodo platform have to use Jumblr?

Author: jspook16#3059
Content: i believe Komodo is transparent by default but allows for private transactions (like zcash). On top of that, jl777 added the jumblr functionality for an added level of privacy.

Author: Audo#5667
Content:
There are two types of transactions: transparent (T) and private (Z).

In addition we have a feature called 'Jumblr' that automatises the process of funneling funds through a Z-address back to a fresh T-address.

Author: jspook16#3059
Content: yes what @Audo said üòÉ

Author: Audo#5667
Content: you were faster üòâ

Author: jspook16#3059
Content: yeah but you're part of the team so your answer is official. Are private transactions only available on native? (as well as jumblr?)

Author: Ray Uber#2790
Content: Is there also a fee for use of private transaction? Or only if you use Jumblr (0,3%)

Author: Audo#5667
Content:
yes you need to run native mode (download the blockchain) to use the Z-addresses & Jumblr.

That might change though, form what I understand, as the Zcash devs are working on something. I don't have the full picture, but it sounds like we might be able to do lightweidght z-transactions in the future.

I believe z-transactions have the standard tx fee, same as t-transactions. Jumblr has an additional fee, yes.

Author: Ray Uber#2790
Content:
thx, got it üëç 
but does this apply only on KMD coin or on every coin on the KMD platform?

Author: jspook16#3059
Content: jumblr is kmd specific from what i understand. I am not sure about the private transactions (whether that applies to just kmd or any asset chain). Also, since ive never actually used this functionality in komodo, i dont know if jumblr is an optional feature or if its part of every private transaction. I think it is optional.

Author: Ray Uber#2790
Content: I mean do the other coins on KMD platform also have the option to choose between t and z transaction. Since they are forks from KMD

Author: Audo#5667
Content:
Jumblr is just for KMD. The private z-transactions are available by default for new assetchains, but that is an optional feature.

The latest development was that now even the T-transactions can be disabled on a new assetchain. That's what the #pirate project is about.... it only has Z-transactions enabled

Author: Audo#5667
Content: so yes @Ray Uber , a project can chose to have a) T + Z, b) T onlye, c) Z only

Author: jspook16#3059
Content: Can I make a z transaction without the jumblr functionality or is jumblr mandatory with every z transaction?

Author: Gordon Komodo#7477
Content: yes you can without jumblr

Author: Gordon Komodo#7477
Content: it is just an address , much like in zcash

Author: Gordon Komodo#7477
Content: Jumblr is an extra feature

Author: jspook16#3059
Content: this is all good info for an infographic

Author: jspook16#3059
Content: @Audo do you know if an 11x17 inch layout is valid for the infographic contest?

Author: Ray Uber#2790
Content: What is the additional advantage of using Jumblr over just using z transactions?

Author: sœÜldat#8733
Content: Jumblr create a private transparent (T) address

Author: jspook16#3059
Content: jumblr uses time delay as well. i think @jl777c was trying to address the possible trace of transactions based on time and quantity. So jumblr breaks down the balance in the transaction to values of 10, 100, 1000 etc, and those get processed at different time intervals

Author: jspook16#3059
Content: someone correct me if Im wrong

Author: Audo#5667
Content: @jspook16 I am not aware of any such constraints. You can double check from @benohanlon though, he's running the contest.

Content: Ok thanks
